{"step_by_step_thinking": "In Dysphonia plica ventricularis, the sound is produced by the false vocal cords. The false vocal cords, also known as the ventricular folds, are located above the true vocal cords in the larynx. They are not involved in normal phonation but can be used to produce sound in certain voice disorders like Dysphonia plica ventricularis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
